hi and welcome you listening to the x-22
report my name is Dave and this is
episode 1288 a and today's date is May
24th 2017 and the thought of the episode
is warning signs are everywhere even
from the central bank's let's get into
the economic collapse financial news now
as we look at this economy we are seeing
warning signs all over the place I mean
when you look at everything that we've
been looking at we can see that the
economy at this point right now here
today it has not improved since 2008
what has improved well the stock market
the printing of currency I don't mean
the actual printing I mean pushing the
button the wealthier got wealthy and
there are more people on food stamps
there are more people that have fallen
off the employment wagon there's more
people looking for jobs retail is
contracting housing is declining
corporate defaults is on the rise auto
manufacturing they're in trouble
auto parts that is in trouble everything
that we've been looking at has been
accelerating it hasn't been slowing down
like hey you know what
yes in 2016 we had 500 stores closed but
in 2017 it's only 200 not bad no 2016 we
had thousands of stores closed the first
part of 2017 thirty-five hundred and
twenty-five bankruptcies projected to be
50 this is not getting better
it's getting worse and as we can see
small businesses well they've been
shrinking since the 90s now of course
the United States is the country of
opportunity where you can start your own
business you can grow it and you can
make a living and live a happy nice life
but things change remember the system
that we're under right now the central
banking system it's not designed to help
the everyday person it's not
designed especially with all the
regulations that they're passing and all
the taxes it's not designed to make you
successful yes in the beginning of the
system it was back in the 70s the 80s
when things were just all coming out and
they were creating currency and their
high interest rates and the value of the
dollar was decreasing and that's why
they raised the interest rates to level
it off and we saw inflation people
thought wow things are really great I
bought a house fifty thousand now it's
worth two hundred and fifty thousand my
income that I was making
I started at five thousand boom it was
pushed up to twenty five thousand this
is incredible well that time has come
and gone start a business people were
getting credit cards then people were
taking out loans to purchase homes and
it got better in the 80s interest rates
came down things got even better credit
was completely accessible went into the
90s then things started to change and
that's what we're seeing right now and
America was the place in the world for
those who wanted to work for themselves
our free market capitalist system it
created an environment which
entrepreneurs and small businesses
greatly thrived but everything has
changed and the number of self-employed
Americans is now lower than it was in
nineteen ninety and if we look at this
we can see in April nineteen ninety
eight point seven million Americans were
self-employed but today only eight point
four million Americans are self-employed
and that number is continually dropping
why because we have the retail
apocalypse and what's not being reported
is all the little tiny mom-and-pop
retail shops that just can't make it all
we're hearing is the big chains that are
going out of business now remember our
population it has grown its much larger
right now and in the 90s there was two
hundred and forty nine million people
living the United States but today
there's three hundred
1 million so what this means is that the
percentage of population that is
self-employed is way down now according
to economist Tim Kaine the number of
startup jobs per 1000 Americans has been
declining for several consecutive
presidential administrations bush senior
eleven point three percent decline
Clinton 11.2% Bush jr. 10.8 percent
Obama seven point eight percent all in
decline again every single sector that
we're looking at has not been improving
except for the stock market of course we
talked about new home sales where
they've declined now existing home sales
they have dropped by 2.3 percent now
let's think about this for a second we
are at the end of May housing sales
usually ramp up starting in March going
into April May and by the time August
hits they start to slow this is the hot
season for real estate no pun intended
this is when the sales come in we're
supposed to see these percentages
skyrocketing right now and if you go
back to my reports last year we saw this
same exact thing actually I think I use
the same exact joke where I said this is
supposed to be the hot season no pun
intended and what's happening right now
is interest rates are creeping up
applications are completely falling and
in the 20 cities where they monitor the
home prices they're showing that yes
home prices are increasing now that's
not happening everywhere but they like
to put that out there that well the
housing market in these certain areas
they're doing well home prices are still
ticking up and everywhere else we don't
want to report on well everywhere else
that's the majority of the country and
if we look at the percentage of sales
from a year ago
the
change in sales we can see according to
price that things are really really bad
I mean price is from zero to a hundred
thousand I don't know anyhow that's from
zero but a hundred thousand dollars or
less down negative sixteen point eight
percent houses from two hundred to two
hundred and fifty thousand down negative
six point three percent and the only
homes that are actually doing well is in
the upper brackets where we're looking
at seven hundred and fifty thousand and
over where they're up around twelve
percent again what we're seeing is a
shift in wealth and everyone else in
between it's not helping and what we've
been seeing is decline in real estate a
decline in retail a decline in auto
sales we're seeing a rise in corporate
defaults we're seeing a rise in the
amount of commercial real estate that's
out there and this whole thing is going
to be disaster now it's not just
happening here in the United States
Canada they have bubbles all over the
place they're deflating throughout
Europe Australia actually the ECB was
out there and they mentioned something
very interesting they said well there's
an excessive exuberance in house prices
and they're saying that well houses in
the European markets they're being
driven by offshore buyers that this
could spread to other areas in a ripple
effect separately the ECB also said debt
sustainability concerns have risen in
the past six months amid a potential
increase in yield and political
uncertainty in some countries now
basically what central banks like to do
is I like to leak out some of these
warnings but it never hits the main
corporate media it's in the back
channels and they keep this there
because when the crisis does hit they
say well we did have the warning out
there so you can't blame us and this is
what they do every single time even
though it's not out in the corporate
media they're going to still tell you
that everything is fine but behind the
scenes behind what is going on they put
out these little warnings and they hope
that nobody's really looking and what is
really happening right now is we're
seeing warning after warning after a
warning now something very interesting
and David Stockman actually mentioned
this that the government would not be
able to make it through August and we
already see White House budget director
Nick Mulvaney he is warning lawmakers
that they might have to vote before they
leave on vacation in August because they
leave August first they don't come back
until after Labor Day because he's
saying that we don't have enough money
to make it through August we don't have
enough tax receipts coming into the
government which is very interesting
because this is exactly what David
Stockman said and as we can see that we
have a major problem here the tax
receipts coming into the government has
continually declined why even though
we're at four point four percent
unemployment we're at full employment no
what's happening is people are losing
their full-time job they lose their
full-time jobs they're not making the
same exact money so that means less
taxes are being paid now those people
who are falling off the market
they're not making anything those people
have taken part-time jobs most likely
they're making a quarter or half of what
they were making so what we're seeing
right now is less money coming into the
government if there's less money coming
into the government that means they
can't pay for all these programs which
means they have to borrow more which
means the situation gets worse and worse
as time goes on and we can see that
eventually what is going to happen as
more and more people lose their jobs and
more more retail stores closed and
corporations layoff
they're not going to be able to borrow
enough to pay for any this because the
tax receipts are going to continually
decline and you know it's you just look
at your own household think about this
if your income continually drops every
month and your expenses go up how long
do you think you could survive how long
do you think you can keep your one or
two cars how long do you think you can
keep your apartment or your house your
Netflix account your Amazon video
account your gym membership and
everything else how long do you think
you can keep this going not much not
long that's what's happening right now
and we can see that the Fed understands
that this whole system can't stay
operational the way it is right now and
this is why their mission right now is
to bring the economy down under Trump
because they need someone to blame and
eventually they'll probably blame him
blame it on him initially and then maybe
they'll show some type of cyber attack
or something hitting the financial
institutions because they need a big
country a big group to blame this on
because they need to bring us to war
that's their eventual goal to cover up
everything so they're not blamed for
this because they can they want to start
this whole thing all over again
and we can see that the Fed had their
meeting their minutes came out of course
they're saying the first quarters
transitory to anomaly don't worry about
that the economy is going to really take
off in the second quarter which we're
not seeing it all actually it's getting
worse now they might manipulate even
further they might throw some soy beans
at the GDP number like they did right
before the elections to show that Obama
had a strong economy but whatever they
do it doesn't matter because they
manipulated statistics that the throwing
at us they're fake but what they are
doing is they're setting it up to raise
the rates again now just raising it a
couple of times they've already done it
looks like it triggered something in the
economy because we're seeing it
celery it looks like they might raise it
again in June which will really
accelerate and bring the system down
because it looks like they are running
out of time and they want to be in full
control of the take down of the system
because this way they can point the
finger they can tell you exactly what
happened just like in some type of
terrorist attack I mean they have the
entire story laid out we know exactly
who they are we know exactly where to
look for them and we capture all these
people within a couple of days I mean
the story is written you know exactly
what's going to happen they know exactly
where they are there's no investigation
whatsoever it's done it's almost like a
cyber attack where they say oh someone
with cyber attacks would three days
later we know exactly who it was how
they did it
what the code is they know exactly
everything this is what they want to do
with the economy they want to have their
story we know exactly how it came down
who was to blame for it and this is what
they're doing now the Fed they are also
broadcasting warnings now not on the
corporate media you're not going to see
this on CNN saying hey the Fed is
warning that the vulnerabilities they're
seeing elevated as valuations and it
poses a risk to financial stability
because that is their warning in their
papers and you're not going to see this
on the corporate media because they
don't broadcast that stuff they'll tell
you the economy is doing fine but they
need this in some type of report to show
people later that no we knew this was
going to happen because when you look
back in time this is what they're going
to show even though you're going to
remember not seeing any of it or saying
that we don't see any of this even if we
go back to 2008 with Ben Bernanke where
he says in our forecasting recession and
you look at their papers you show that
yes something was going on they show
that there was a problem they know
exactly what's happening they cover
themselves that's what they're doing now
they understand they realize that things
are breaking apart when we have to
remember
Bank of America based on 20
widely-used valuation metrics the SNP
remains significantly overvalued on 18
of the 20 valuation metrics so what is
happening right now is we're seeing a
push to bring down the system now on the
other side Trump is out of the country
but his push is to bring down the system
this is why all the bubbles are being
blown up this is why he's looking at all

sure that we have the ability to sustain

deals are gonna have to be renegotiated
everything has to be redone because the
dollar will not be involved with this it
won't be the reserve currency anymore
and giving countries dollars they're not
just going to give us their products
it's not just going to happen like that
we're going to have to have some type of
trade and this is what he's preparing
for now he's pushing his budget we know
this is not going to pass and he's
showing that listen we have two choices
here it's either we cut like there's no
tomorrow and people are going to have to
go out and fend for themselves
and I know this economy is not driven to
help people and this is why the central
banks this is why the government this is
why they like people on all of these
type of programs it keeps them quiet
think about if we didn't have these
programs you think people will be
picketing and very upset that they can't
live I mean think about 47 million
people on food stamps before the Great
Recession it was like 27 million now
it's 47 million maybe it's a little less
44 or something like that but it's much
much higher and it really hasn't
decreased if you took all those people
out of the program take to get rid of
all the entitlement programs and
everything like that how do you think
people are going to react do you think
they'd be upset you think they'd be
picketing you think they'd be angry at
the government and what they have done
this is why they have these programs to
keep everyone quiet you want to keep
receiving the money keep your mouth shut
be happy you're getting it now they try
to make it seem like well we're helping
you people depend on this no you know
what people would rather have they'd
rather have a great job great health
benefits they'd rather have they'd
rather support their family and they'd

you will need to depend on yourself

all these programs will disappear and
you're going to have to figure it all

supplies
gold silver cryptocurrency cash on hand
cover all bases and make sure you are

listen everyone thanks a lot for
